headline: Here are the candidates running in Pennsylvania primary for U.S. Senate, governor and Congress
author: Eugene Tauber
sentences:
George Bochetto, Philadelphia
Sean Gale, Plymouth Township, Montgomery
Dave McCormick, Pittsburgh, Allegheny
Jeff Bartos, Lower Merion Township, Montgomery
Kathy Barnette, Lower Moreland Township, Montgomery
Mehmet Oz, Bryn Athyn, Montgomery
Carla Sands, Wormleysburg, Cumberland
Charlie Gerow, Hampden Township, Cumberland
Dave White, Ridley Township, Delaware
Lou Barletta, Hazleton, Luzerne
Jason Richey, Sewickley Heights, Allegheny
Douglas V. Mastriano, Greene Township, Franklin
Joe Gale, Plymouth Township, Montgomery
Bill McSwain, West Chester, Chester
Melissa Hart, Bradford Woods, Allegheny
Jake Corman, Bellefonte, Centre

John Brown, Bangor, Northampton
Russ Diamond, Annville Township, Lebanon

The deadline for filing for the state’s legislative races remains up in the air as the state Supreme Court considers legal challenges to maps approved by the state’s Legislative Reapportionment Commission.
Contests of high interest include wide-open races to replace U.S. Sen. Pat Toomey, who is not seeking reelection, and a crowded Republican field in the race to succeed Gov.
Pennsylvania’s primary for Democrats and Republicans will be held May 17, but Tuesday was the final day for prospective candidates to file their petitions with the state.
Since Pennsylvania is a closed primary state, only Democrats can vote for Democrats, and only Republicans can vote for Republicans.
Below is a list of candidates who filed by the deadline, listed in the order decided by the Pennsylvania State Department.
Also on the primary ballot will be races for lieutenant governor and the state’s 17 congressional districts.
By convention, candidates of the party of the sitting governor are listed first.
Third party and unaffiliated voters can only vote on ballot questions.
